required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Lapatinib Versus Placebo Given Concurrently With Cisplatin And Radiotherapy In Patients With Unresected Head And Neck Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo Controlled, Multicentre, Phase II Study of Oral Lapatinib in Combination With Concurrent Radiotherapy and Cisplatin Versus Radiotherapy and Cisplatin Alone, in Subjects With Stage III, IVA, B Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck (SCCHN)

brief_summary.textblock: This is a phase II study comparing the effects of lapatinib versus placebo when administered concurrently with cisplatin and radiotherapy followed by 1 year monotherapy with lapatinib or placebo. The study is designed to evaluate and compare the two treatment groups with respect to complete response rate at 6 months following chemoradiation completion.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants (Par.) With Complete Response (CR), as Assessed by Independent Radiological Review
primary_outcome.time_frame: From the date of randomization until 6 months post chemoradiation treatment, assessed for a median time of 13 months
primary_outcome.description: Participants with CR are defined as those who achieved a complete tumor response at 6 months after the completion of the chemoradiation treatment (CRT), as assessed by independent radiological review. Tumor response was assessed using modified Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) criteria. Per RECIST, CR is defined as the disappearance of all target and non-target lesions. Data are based on Week 24 scans from participants receiving study treatment at that time and on those in follow-up.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With CR, as Assessed by the Investigator
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the date of randomization until 6 months post chemoradiation treatment, assessed after a median time of 13 months of follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Participants with CR are defined as those who achieved a complete tumor response at 6 months after the completion of the CRT, as determined by the investigator. Tumor response was assessed using modified RECIST criteria. Per RECIST, CR is defined as the disappearance of all target and non-target lesions. Data are based on Week 24 scans from participants receiving study treatment at that time and on those in follow-up.

secondary_outcome.measure: Progression-Free Survival (PFS), as Assessed by the Investigator
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the date of randomization until the date of disease progression or death due to any cause, assessed after a median of 22 months of follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: PFS=the time from randomization until the earliest date of disease progression or death due to any cause, if sooner. Per RECIST, progressive disease=a >=20% increase in the sum of the longest diameter of target lesions (TLs), or the appearance of >=1 new L, symptomatic progression and/or unequivocal progression of existing non-TLs. For participants who did not progress or die at the time of reporting (data cut-off 1-Aug-2014), PFS data were censored at the time of the last investigator assessed radiological scan preceding the initiation of any alternative anti-cancer therapy.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the date of randomization until the date of death due to any cause, assessed after a median of 30.9 months
secondary_outcome.description: OS is defined as the time from randomization until death due to any cause. Time to death (data cut-off 1-Aug-2014) was censored at the time of last contact for participants who did not die.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Died Due to Progressive Disease
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the date of randomization until the date of death due to disease under study, assessed after a median of 30.9 months
secondary_outcome.description: The number of participants who died due to progressive disease (a >=20% increase in the sum of the longest diameter of target lesions, or the appearance of >=1 new lesion, symptomatic progression and/or unequivocal progression of existing non-target lesions), or died due to head and neck cancer without evidence of disease progression, after randomization in the study is presented, using a data cut of 1 August 2014.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the date of randomization until the date of death due to disease, assessed after a median of 13 months of follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Disease-specific survival is defined as the time from randomization until death due to head and neck cancer.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Loco-regional Recurrence of Initial Disease
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the date of randomization until progression in the T or N site or death due to any cause, assessed after a median of 30.9 months
secondary_outcome.description: Participants with loco-regional recurrence were those who had progression of disease in the T and N sites. Per the Tumor, Node, and Metastases (TNM) staging of tumors: T describes the size of the tumor and whether it has invaded nearby tissue, and N describes regional lymph nodes that are involved. If a participant had progression in the T or N sites, then the participant was counted as having had an event of interest.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the date of randomization until progression in the T or N site or death due to any cause, assessed after a median of 30.9 months
secondary_outcome.description: Loco-regional control is defined as the time from the date of randomization until progression in the T or N site. Participants who died or had secondary primary malignancies in the head and neck region outside of the T and N site or distant metastasis were not counted as an event and were instead treated as competing risks. Per the TNM staging of tumors: T describes the size of the tumor and whether it has invaded nearby tissue, and N describes regional lymph nodes that are involved. Due to the minimal events reported (data cut-off 30-Sep-2010), valid analysis could not be performed for loco-regional control rate.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Distant Recurrence of Initial Disease
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the date of randomization until the first occurrence of distant metastasis, assessed after a median of 30.9 months
secondary_outcome.description: Participants were analyzed for the occurrence of distant metastasis (spread of a disease from one organ or part to another non-adjacent organ or part) after randomization in the study until data cut-off date 1-Aug-2014. Participants who died or had recurrence of disease in the T or N sites or secondary primary malignancies in the head and neck region outside of the original T and N site were not counted as an event and were instead treated as competing risks.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the date of randomization until the first occurrence of distant metastasis, assessed after a median of 30.9 months
secondary_outcome.description: Distant relapse is defined as the time from the date of randomization until the first occurrence of distant metastasis (spread of a disease from one organ or part to another non-adjacent organ of part). Participants who died or had recurrence of disease in the T or N sites or secondary primary malignancies in the head and neck region outside of the original T and N site were not counted as an event and were instead treated as competing risks.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Overall Response (OR), as Assessed by the Investigator
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the date of randomization until 6 months post chemoradiation treatment, assessed for a median of 13 months
secondary_outcome.description: Participants with OR were those who achieved either a CR or partial response (PR) from the assessment of overall tumor response at 6 months (24 weeks) following completion of CRT (data cut-off 30-Sep-2010). Per RECIST, CR is defined as the disappearance of all target and non-target lesions; PR is defined as at least a 30% decrease in the sum of the long diameter (LD) of target lesions, taking as a reference, the baseline sum LD. Data are based on Week 24 scans from participants receiving study treatment at that time point.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Positive and Negative for the Expression of Biomarkers in Tumor Tissue: Human Epidermal Growth Factor Receptor (HER)-1, HER2, HER3, HER4, P16, and Transforming Growth Factor (TGF-alpha)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 28 days prior to the date of the first dose of lapatinib/placebo start
secondary_outcome.description: Paraffin-embedded tissue block (or sections) from archived tumor tissue sample, if available (from time of original diagnosis) or fresh tumor tissue, was sent for testing to determine intra-tumoral biomarker expression by immunohistochemistry (IHC) or fluorescent in situ hybridization (FISH) assay. Stained tumor slides or tissue micro arrays (TMAs) were scored by a pathologist from 0 (no expression) to 3+ (high expression). An expression level of >=2+ was considered positive.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From up to 28 days prior to the first dose of lapatinib/placebo start to 8 weeks after the first dose
secondary_outcome.description: Proteomic analyses of blood plasma samples were to be conducted to identify any changes in the proteome profile that could be related to the treatment response. Examination of pre-dosing (screening) plasma protein profiles could uncover novel blood-borne protein candidate biomarkers/profiles, which could be used to predict drug response.

secondary_outcome.measure: Analysis of Deoxyribonucleic Acid (DNA) and Ribonucleic Acid (RNA) From Tumor Samples
secondary_outcome.description: No analysis was performed for tumor sample RNA/DNA.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Negative and Positive for Human Papilloma Virus (HPV) Infection, as Determined From Tumor Samples
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 28 days prior to the first dose of lapatinib/placebo
secondary_outcome.description: Analysis was performed for HPV infection analysis from the tumor biopsy samples obtained during the Screening period. p16 was used as a marker for HPV; thus, "negative" participants did not have the p16 marker.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Positive and Negative for Biomarker HER1/ErbB1 Categorized in the Indicated Independent Review Panel-assessed Tumor Responses by Expression of Biomarkers From Tumor Tissue: Sensitivity Analysis - 0 Versus (1, 2, 3)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the date of randomization until 6 months post chemoradiation treatment, assessed for up to 24 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Tumor tissue (fresh or archived) was sent to a central laboratory for biomarker HER1/ErbB1 and tumor genetics analysis up to 1 week after randomization. Per RECIST: CR, disappearance of all lesions; PR, a >=30% decrease in the sum of the longest dimensions (LD) of the target lesions (TLs) taking as a reference the baseline sum LD; Progressive disease (PD), a >=20% increase in the sum of the LD of TLs, or the appearance of >=1 new lesion; Stable Disease (SD), neither PR nor PD, persistence of >=1 non-TL. 0=negative; 1, 2, 3=positive (increasing level of biomarker expression).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Positive and Negative for Biomarker HER1/ErbB1 Categorized in the Indicated Independent Review Panel-assessed Tumor Responses by Expression of Biomarkers From Tumor Tissues: Sensitivity Analysis - 0, 1, 2 Versus 3
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the date of randomization until 6 months post chemoradiation treatment, assessed for up to 24 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Tumor tissue (fresh or archived) was sent to a central laboratory for biomarker HER1/ErbB1 and tumor genetics analysis up to 1 week after randomization. Per RECIST: CR, disappearance of all lesions; PR, a >=30% decrease in the sum of the longest dimensions (LD) of the target lesions (TLs) taking as a reference the baseline sum LD; Progressive disease (PD), a >=20% increase in the sum of the LD of TLs, or the appearance of >=1 new lesion; Stable Disease (SD), neither PR nor PD, persistence of >=1 non-TL. 0=negative; 1, 2, 3=positive (increasing level of biomarker expression).

other_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Classified as Responders, as Per Volumetric Tumor Response
other_outcome.time_frame: From the date of randomization until 6 months post chemoradiation treatment, assessed for a median of 13 months

intervention.description: Lapatinib is administered orally once daily.

Radiotherapy is given either as conventional fractionation using Two-dimensional (2D) or conformal techniques, or as Intensity Modulated Radiation Therapy (IMRT). Radiation therapy will be standardised throughout the study. Radiation therapy is given only once daily, with a dose/fraction not exceeding 2.5Gy, to a total dose of 65 Gy (IMRT) or 70 Gy (2D or 3D RT) to the gross site of disease .
Cisplatin is administered intravenously at a dose of 100mg/m2 on days 1, 22 and 43 of radiotherapy (approximately Study Days 8, 29 and 50).

reference.citation: Harrington K, Berrier A, Robinson M, Remenar E, Housset M, de Mendoza FH, Fayette J, Mehanna H, El-Hariry I, Compton N, Franklin N, Biswas-Baldwin N, Lau M, Legenne P, Kumar R. Randomised Phase II study of oral lapatinib combined with chemoradiotherapy in patients with advanced squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck: rationale for future randomised trials in human papilloma virus-negative disease. Eur J Cancer. 2013 May;49(7):1609-18. doi: 10.1016/j.ejca.2012.11.023. Epub 2012 Dec 19.

clinical_study.keyword: Locally advanced head and neck cancer

group.title: Chemoradiotherapy + Placebo, Followed by Placebo
group.description: Participants received radiotherapy once daily (OD), with a dose/fraction <2.5 Gray (Gy) to a total dose of 70 Gy (using two-dimensional [2D] or 3D techniques) or 65 Gy (using Intensity Modulated Radiation Therapy [IMRT]) to the gross site of disease. Concurrent chemotherapy of cisplatin 100 milligrams per meters squared (mg/m^2) was administered intravenously (IV) on Days 1, 22, and 43 of the course of radiotherapy (Study Days 8, 29, and 50). Matching placebo administration commenced 1 week (or less than or equal to 3 days) prior to the concurrent administration with chemoradiation for a duration of up to 6 to 7 weeks. After the completion of chemoradiotherapy, placebo monotherapy was administered until disease progression or withdrawal.

group.title: Chemoradiotherapy + Lapatinib, Followed by Lapatinib
group.description: Participants received radiotherapy once daily (OD), with a dose/fraction <2.5 Gy to a total dose of 70 Gy (using 2D or 3D techniques) or 65 Gy (using IMRT) to the gross site of disease. Concurrent chemotherapy of cisplatin 100 mg/m^2 was administered IV on Days 1, 22, and 43 of the course of radiotherapy (Study Days 8, 29, and 50). Lapatinib 1500 mg OD administration commenced 1 week (or less than or equal to 3 days) prior to the concurrent administration with chemoradiation for a duration of up to 6 to 7 weeks. After the completion of chemoradiotherapy, lapatinib 1500 mg OD monotherapy was administered until disease progression or withdrawal.

group.description: Total of all reporting groups

analysis.p_value_desc: From exact test that common odds ratio equals 1
analysis.param_type: Difference in percentage of par. with CR
analysis.estimate_desc: Complete response was defined as the percentage of participants achieving a CR as determined by an independent radiological review.

measure.population: ITT Population. For participants who did not die, time to death was censored at the time of last contact.

measurement_list.measurement: The cumulative incidence in the placebo arm remained lower than 50%, so the median and upper quartile were not observed.
The cumulative incidence remained lower than 25% in the lapatinib arm, so neither the median nor the inter-quartile range were observed.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Loco-regional Recurrence of Initial Disease
outcome.description: Participants with loco-regional recurrence were those who had progression of disease in the T and N sites. Per the Tumor, Node, and Metastases (TNM) staging of tumors: T describes the size of the tumor and whether it has invaded nearby tissue, and N describes regional lymph nodes that are involved. If a participant had progression in the T or N sites, then the participant was counted as having had an event of interest.
outcome.time_frame: From the date of randomization until progression in the T or N site or death due to any cause, assessed after a median of 30.9 months

group.title: Chemoradiotherapy + Placebo, Followed by Placebo
group.description: Participants received radiotherapy once daily (OD), with a dose/fraction <2.5 Gray (Gy) to a total dose of 70 Gy (using two-dimensional [2D] or 3D techniques) or 65 Gy (using Intensity Modulated Radiation Therapy [IMRT]) to the gross site of disease. Concurrent chemotherapy of cisplatin 100 milligrams per meters squared (mg/m^2) was administered intravenously (IV) on Days 1, 22, and 43 of the course of radiotherapy (Study Days 8, 29, and 50). Matching placebo administration commenced 1 week (or less than or equal to 3 days) prior to the concurrent administration with chemoradiation for a duration of up to 6 to 7 weeks. After the completion of chemoradiotherapy, placebo monotherapy was administered until disease progression or withdrawal.

group.title: Chemoradiotherapy + Lapatinib, Followed by Lapatinib
group.description: Participants received radiotherapy once daily (OD), with a dose/fraction <2.5 Gy to a total dose of 70 Gy (using 2D or 3D techniques) or 65 Gy (using IMRT) to the gross site of disease. Concurrent chemotherapy of cisplatin 100 mg/m^2 was administered IV on Days 1, 22, and 43 of the course of radiotherapy (Study Days 8, 29, and 50). Lapatinib 1500 mg OD administration commenced 1 week (or less than or equal to 3 days) prior to the concurrent administration with chemoradiation for a duration of up to 6 to 7 weeks. After the completion of chemoradiotherapy, lapatinib 1500 mg OD monotherapy was administered until disease progression or withdrawal.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Loco-regional Recurrence of Initial Disease
measure.description: Participants with loco-regional recurrence were those who had progression of disease in the T and N sites. Per the Tumor, Node, and Metastases (TNM) staging of tumors: T describes the size of the tumor and whether it has invaded nearby tissue, and N describes regional lymph nodes that are involved. If a participant had progression in the T or N sites, then the participant was counted as having had an event of interest.

outcome.title: Loco-regional Control
outcome.description: Loco-regional control is defined as the time from the date of randomization until progression in the T or N site. Participants who died or had secondary primary malignancies in the head and neck region outside of the T and N site or distant metastasis were not counted as an event and were instead treated as competing risks. Per the TNM staging of tumors: T describes the size of the tumor and whether it has invaded nearby tissue, and N describes regional lymph nodes that are involved. Due to the minimal events reported (data cut-off 30-Sep-2010), valid analysis could not be performed for loco-regional control rate.
outcome.time_frame: From the date of randomization until progression in the T or N site or death due to any cause, assessed after a median of 30.9 months

group.title: Chemoradiotherapy + Placebo, Followed by Placebo
group.description: Participants received radiotherapy once daily (OD), with a dose/fraction <2.5 Gray (Gy) to a total dose of 70 Gy (using two-dimensional [2D] or 3D techniques) or 65 Gy (using Intensity Modulated Radiation Therapy [IMRT]) to the gross site of disease. Concurrent chemotherapy of cisplatin 100 milligrams per meters squared (mg/m^2) was administered intravenously (IV) on Days 1, 22, and 43 of the course of radiotherapy (Study Days 8, 29, and 50). Matching placebo administration commenced 1 week (or less than or equal to 3 days) prior to the concurrent administration with chemoradiation for a duration of up to 6 to 7 weeks. After the completion of chemoradiotherapy, placebo monotherapy was administered until disease progression or withdrawal.

group.title: Chemoradiotherapy + Lapatinib, Followed by Lapatinib
group.description: Participants received radiotherapy once daily (OD), with a dose/fraction <2.5 Gy to a total dose of 70 Gy (using 2D or 3D techniques) or 65 Gy (using IMRT) to the gross site of disease. Concurrent chemotherapy of cisplatin 100 mg/m^2 was administered IV on Days 1, 22, and 43 of the course of radiotherapy (Study Days 8, 29, and 50). Lapatinib 1500 mg OD administration commenced 1 week (or less than or equal to 3 days) prior to the concurrent administration with chemoradiation for a duration of up to 6 to 7 weeks. After the completion of chemoradiotherapy, lapatinib 1500 mg OD monotherapy was administered until disease progression or withdrawal.

measure.title: Loco-regional Control
measure.description: Loco-regional control is defined as the time from the date of randomization until progression in the T or N site. Participants who died or had secondary primary malignancies in the head and neck region outside of the T and N site or distant metastasis were not counted as an event and were instead treated as competing risks. Per the TNM staging of tumors: T describes the size of the tumor and whether it has invaded nearby tissue, and N describes regional lymph nodes that are involved. Due to the minimal events reported (data cut-off 30-Sep-2010), valid analysis could not be performed for loco-regional control rate.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Distant Recurrence of Initial Disease
outcome.description: Participants were analyzed for the occurrence of distant metastasis (spread of a disease from one organ or part to another non-adjacent organ or part) after randomization in the study until data cut-off date 1-Aug-2014. Participants who died or had recurrence of disease in the T or N sites or secondary primary malignancies in the head and neck region outside of the original T and N site were not counted as an event and were instead treated as competing risks.
outcome.time_frame: From the date of randomization until the first occurrence of distant metastasis, assessed after a median of 30.9 months

group.title: Chemoradiotherapy + Placebo, Followed by Placebo
group.description: Participants received radiotherapy once daily (OD), with a dose/fraction <2.5 Gray (Gy) to a total dose of 70 Gy (using two-dimensional [2D] or 3D techniques) or 65 Gy (using Intensity Modulated Radiation Therapy [IMRT]) to the gross site of disease. Concurrent chemotherapy of cisplatin 100 milligrams per meters squared (mg/m^2) was administered intravenously (IV) on Days 1, 22, and 43 of the course of radiotherapy (Study Days 8, 29, and 50). Matching placebo administration commenced 1 week (or less than or equal to 3 days) prior to the concurrent administration with chemoradiation for a duration of up to 6 to 7 weeks. After the completion of chemoradiotherapy, placebo monotherapy was administered until disease progression or withdrawal.

group.title: Chemoradiotherapy + Lapatinib, Followed by Lapatinib
group.description: Participants received radiotherapy once daily (OD), with a dose/fraction <2.5 Gy to a total dose of 70 Gy (using 2D or 3D techniques) or 65 Gy (using IMRT) to the gross site of disease. Concurrent chemotherapy of cisplatin 100 mg/m^2 was administered IV on Days 1, 22, and 43 of the course of radiotherapy (Study Days 8, 29, and 50). Lapatinib 1500 mg OD administration commenced 1 week (or less than or equal to 3 days) prior to the concurrent administration with chemoradiation for a duration of up to 6 to 7 weeks. After the completion of chemoradiotherapy, lapatinib 1500 mg OD monotherapy was administered until disease progression or withdrawal.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Distant Recurrence of Initial Disease
measure.description: Participants were analyzed for the occurrence of distant metastasis (spread of a disease from one organ or part to another non-adjacent organ or part) after randomization in the study until data cut-off date 1-Aug-2014. Participants who died or had recurrence of disease in the T or N sites or secondary primary malignancies in the head and neck region outside of the original T and N site were not counted as an event and were instead treated as competing risks.

outcome.title: Distant Relapse
outcome.description: Distant relapse is defined as the time from the date of randomization until the first occurrence of distant metastasis (spread of a disease from one organ or part to another non-adjacent organ of part). Participants who died or had recurrence of disease in the T or N sites or secondary primary malignancies in the head and neck region outside of the original T and N site were not counted as an event and were instead treated as competing risks.
outcome.time_frame: From the date of randomization until the first occurrence of distant metastasis, assessed after a median of 30.9 months
outcome.population: ITT Population. If a participant had a distant metastasis and then died, then the participant was counted as having had an event of interest.

group.title: Chemoradiotherapy + Placebo, Followed by Placebo
group.description: Participants received radiotherapy once daily (OD), with a dose/fraction <2.5 Gray (Gy) to a total dose of 70 Gy (using two-dimensional [2D] or 3D techniques) or 65 Gy (using Intensity Modulated Radiation Therapy [IMRT]) to the gross site of disease. Concurrent chemotherapy of cisplatin 100 milligrams per meters squared (mg/m^2) was administered intravenously (IV) on Days 1, 22, and 43 of the course of radiotherapy (Study Days 8, 29, and 50). Matching placebo administration commenced 1 week (or less than or equal to 3 days) prior to the concurrent administration with chemoradiation for a duration of up to 6 to 7 weeks. After the completion of chemoradiotherapy, placebo monotherapy was administered until disease progression or withdrawal.

group.title: Chemoradiotherapy + Lapatinib, Followed by Lapatinib
group.description: Participants received radiotherapy once daily (OD), with a dose/fraction <2.5 Gy to a total dose of 70 Gy (using 2D or 3D techniques) or 65 Gy (using IMRT) to the gross site of disease. Concurrent chemotherapy of cisplatin 100 mg/m^2 was administered IV on Days 1, 22, and 43 of the course of radiotherapy (Study Days 8, 29, and 50). Lapatinib 1500 mg OD administration commenced 1 week (or less than or equal to 3 days) prior to the concurrent administration with chemoradiation for a duration of up to 6 to 7 weeks. After the completion of chemoradiotherapy, lapatinib 1500 mg OD monotherapy was administered until disease progression or withdrawal.

measure.title: Distant Relapse
measure.description: Distant relapse is defined as the time from the date of randomization until the first occurrence of distant metastasis (spread of a disease from one organ or part to another non-adjacent organ of part). Participants who died or had recurrence of disease in the T or N sites or secondary primary malignancies in the head and neck region outside of the original T and N site were not counted as an event and were instead treated as competing risks.
measure.population: ITT Population. If a participant had a distant metastasis and then died, then the participant was counted as having had an event of interest.

measurement_list.measurement: The cumulative incidence remained below 25% in the placebo arm, so neither the median nor the inter-quartile range were observed.
The cumulative incidence in the lapatinib arm did not reach 50% (most participants had not relapsed), so the median and the upper limit of the interquartile range were not observed.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Overall Response (OR), as Assessed by the Investigator
outcome.description: Participants with OR were those who achieved either a CR or partial response (PR) from the assessment of overall tumor response at 6 months (24 weeks) following completion of CRT (data cut-off 30-Sep-2010). Per RECIST, CR is defined as the disappearance of all target and non-target lesions; PR is defined as at least a 30% decrease in the sum of the long diameter (LD) of target lesions, taking as a reference, the baseline sum LD. Data are based on Week 24 scans from participants receiving study treatment at that time point.
outcome.time_frame: From the date of randomization until 6 months post chemoradiation treatment, assessed for a median of 13 months

group.title: Chemoradiotherapy + Placebo, Followed by Placebo
group.description: Participants received radiotherapy once daily (OD), with a dose/fraction <2.5 Gray (Gy) to a total dose of 70 Gy (using two-dimensional [2D] or 3D techniques) or 65 Gy (using Intensity Modulated Radiation Therapy [IMRT]) to the gross site of disease. Concurrent chemotherapy of cisplatin 100 milligrams per meters squared (mg/m^2) was administered intravenously (IV) on Days 1, 22, and 43 of the course of radiotherapy (Study Days 8, 29, and 50). Matching placebo administration commenced 1 week (or less than or equal to 3 days) prior to the concurrent administration with chemoradiation for a duration of up to 6 to 7 weeks. After the completion of chemoradiotherapy, placebo monotherapy was administered until disease progression or withdrawal.

group.title: Chemoradiotherapy + Lapatinib, Followed by Lapatinib
group.description: Participants received radiotherapy once daily (OD), with a dose/fraction <2.5 Gy to a total dose of 70 Gy (using 2D or 3D techniques) or 65 Gy (using IMRT) to the gross site of disease. Concurrent chemotherapy of cisplatin 100 mg/m^2 was administered IV on Days 1, 22, and 43 of the course of radiotherapy (Study Days 8, 29, and 50). Lapatinib 1500 mg OD administration commenced 1 week (or less than or equal to 3 days) prior to the concurrent administration with chemoradiation for a duration of up to 6 to 7 weeks. After the completion of chemoradiotherapy, lapatinib 1500 mg OD monotherapy was administered until disease progression or withdrawal.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Overall Response (OR), as Assessed by the Investigator
measure.description: Participants with OR were those who achieved either a CR or partial response (PR) from the assessment of overall tumor response at 6 months (24 weeks) following completion of CRT (data cut-off 30-Sep-2010). Per RECIST, CR is defined as the disappearance of all target and non-target lesions; PR is defined as at least a 30% decrease in the sum of the long diameter (LD) of target lesions, taking as a reference, the baseline sum LD. Data are based on Week 24 scans from participants receiving study treatment at that time point.

analysis.p_value_desc: From exact test that common odds ratio equals 1
analysis.estimate_desc: Overall response was defined as the percentage of participants achieving a PR or CR as determined by the investigator.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Positive and Negative for the Expression of Biomarkers in Tumor Tissue: Human Epidermal Growth Factor Receptor (HER)-1, HER2, HER3, HER4, P16, and Transforming Growth Factor (TGF-alpha)
outcome.description: Paraffin-embedded tissue block (or sections) from archived tumor tissue sample, if available (from time of original diagnosis) or fresh tumor tissue, was sent for testing to determine intra-tumoral biomarker expression by immunohistochemistry (IHC) or fluorescent in situ hybridization (FISH) assay. Stained tumor slides or tissue micro arrays (TMAs) were scored by a pathologist from 0 (no expression) to 3+ (high expression). An expression level of >=2+ was considered positive.
outcome.time_frame: Up to 28 days prior to the date of the first dose of lapatinib/placebo start
outcome.population: ITT Population. Only those participants who had sufficient tumor sample for testing were analyzed.

group.title: Chemoradiotherapy + Placebo, Followed by Placebo
group.description: Participants received radiotherapy once daily (OD), with a dose/fraction <2.5 Gray (Gy) to a total dose of 70 Gy (using two-dimensional [2D] or 3D techniques) or 65 Gy (using Intensity Modulated Radiation Therapy [IMRT]) to the gross site of disease. Concurrent chemotherapy of cisplatin 100 milligrams per meters squared (mg/m^2) was administered intravenously (IV) on Days 1, 22, and 43 of the course of radiotherapy (Study Days 8, 29, and 50). Matching placebo administration commenced 1 week (or less than or equal to 3 days) prior to the concurrent administration with chemoradiation for a duration of up to 6 to 7 weeks. After the completion of chemoradiotherapy, placebo monotherapy was administered until disease progression or withdrawal.

group.title: Chemoradiotherapy + Lapatinib, Followed by Lapatinib
group.description: Participants received radiotherapy once daily (OD), with a dose/fraction <2.5 Gy to a total dose of 70Gy (using 2D or 3D techniques) or 65 Gy (using IMRT) to the gross site of disease. Concurrent chemotherapy of cisplatin 100 mg/m^2 was administered IV on Days 1, 22, and 43 of the course of radiotherapy (Study Days 8, 29, and 50). Lapatinib 1500 mg OD administration commenced 1 week (or less than or equal to 3 days) prior to the concurrent administration with chemoradiation for a duration of up to 6 to 7 weeks. After the completion of chemoradiotherapy, lapatinib 1500 mg OD monotherapy was administered until disease progression or withdrawal.

measure.title: Number of Participants Positive and Negative for the Expression of Biomarkers in Tumor Tissue: Human Epidermal Growth Factor Receptor (HER)-1, HER2, HER3, HER4, P16, and Transforming Growth Factor (TGF-alpha)
measure.description: Paraffin-embedded tissue block (or sections) from archived tumor tissue sample, if available (from time of original diagnosis) or fresh tumor tissue, was sent for testing to determine intra-tumoral biomarker expression by immunohistochemistry (IHC) or fluorescent in situ hybridization (FISH) assay. Stained tumor slides or tissue micro arrays (TMAs) were scored by a pathologist from 0 (no expression) to 3+ (high expression). An expression level of >=2+ was considered positive.
measure.population: ITT Population. Only those participants who had sufficient tumor sample for testing were analyzed.

outcome.title: Plasma Proteome Analysis
outcome.description: Proteomic analyses of blood plasma samples were to be conducted to identify any changes in the proteome profile that could be related to the treatment response. Examination of pre-dosing (screening) plasma protein profiles could uncover novel blood-borne protein candidate biomarkers/profiles, which could be used to predict drug response.
outcome.time_frame: From up to 28 days prior to the first dose of lapatinib/placebo start to 8 weeks after the first dose
outcome.population: ITT Population. Plasma proteome data have not been analyzed (tested); thus, data are not available to disclose. Based on the negative outcome of Study EGF102988 (NCT00424255), no suitable analyses have been proposed for this small sample size.

group.title: Chemoradiotherapy + Placebo, Followed by Placebo
group.description: Participants received radiotherapy once daily (OD), with a dose/fraction <2.5 Gray (Gy) to a total dose of 70 Gy (using two-dimensional [2D] or 3D techniques) or 65 Gy (using Intensity Modulated Radiation Therapy [IMRT]) to the gross site of disease. Concurrent chemotherapy of cisplatin 100 milligrams per meters squared (mg/m^2) was administered intravenously (IV) on Days 1, 22, and 43 of the course of radiotherapy (Study Days 8, 29, and 50). Matching placebo administration commenced 1 week (or less than or equal to 3 days) prior to the concurrent administration with chemoradiation for a duration of up to 6 to 7 weeks. After the completion of chemoradiotherapy, placebo monotherapy was administered until disease progression or withdrawal.

Examination of pre-dosing (screening) plasma protein profiles could uncover novel blood-borne protein candidate biomarkers/profiles, which could be used to predict drug response.

outcome.title: Analysis of Deoxyribonucleic Acid (DNA) and Ribonucleic Acid (RNA) From Tumor Samples
outcome.description: No analysis was performed for tumor sample RNA/DNA.
outcome.population: ITT Population. DNA/RNA from tumors has not been analyzed (tested); therefore, data are not available. No suitable analyses of DNA/RNA have been proposed for this small sample size of tumor samples.

group.title: Chemoradiotherapy + Placebo, Followed by Placebo
group.description: Participants received radiotherapy once daily (OD), with a dose/fraction <2.5 Gray (Gy) to a total dose of 70 Gy (using two-dimensional [2D] or 3D techniques) or 65 Gy (using Intensity Modulated Radiation Therapy [IMRT]) to the gross site of disease. measure.description: No analysis was performed for tumor sample RNA/DNA.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Negative and Positive for Human Papilloma Virus (HPV) Infection, as Determined From Tumor Samples
outcome.description: Analysis was performed for HPV infection analysis from the tumor biopsy samples obtained during the Screening period. p16 was used as a marker for HPV; thus, "negative" participants did not have the p16 marker.
outcome.time_frame: Up to 28 days prior to the first dose of lapatinib/placebo

group.title: Chemoradiotherapy + Placebo, Followed by Placebo
group.description: Participants received radiotherapy once daily (OD), with a dose/fraction <2.5 Gray (Gy) to a total dose of 70 Gy (using two-dimensional [2D] or 3D techniques) or 65 Gy (using Intensity Modulated Radiation Therapy [IMRT]) to the gross site of disease. Concurrent chemotherapy of cisplatin 100 milligrams per meters squared (mg/m^2) was administered intravenously (IV) on Days 1, 22, and 43 of the course of radiotherapy (Study Days 8, 29, and 50). Matching placebo administration commenced 1 week (or less than or equal to 3 days) prior to the concurrent administration with chemoradiation for a duration of up to 6 to 7 weeks. After the completion of chemoradiotherapy, placebo monotherapy was administered until disease progression or withdrawal.

group.description: Participants received radiotherapy once daily (OD), with a dose/fraction <2.5 Gy to a total dose of 70 Gy (using 2D or 3D techniques) or 65 Gy (using IMRT) to the gross site of disease. Concurrent chemotherapy of cisplatin 100 mg/m^2 was administered IV on Days 1, 22, and 43 of the course of radiotherapy (Study Days 8, 29, and 50). Lapatinib 1500 mg OD administration commenced 1 week (or less than or equal to 3 days) prior to the concurrent administration with chemoradiation for a duration of up to 6 to 7 weeks. After the completion of chemoradiotherapy, lapatinib 1500 mg OD monotherapy was administered until disease progression or withdrawal.

measure.title: Number of Participants Negative and Positive for Human Papilloma Virus (HPV) Infection, as Determined From Tumor Samples
measure.description: Analysis was performed for HPV infection analysis from the tumor biopsy samples obtained during the Screening period. p16 was used as a marker for HPV; thus, "negative" participants did not have the p16 marker.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Positive and Negative for Biomarker HER1/ErbB1 Categorized in the Indicated Independent Review Panel-assessed Tumor Responses by Expression of Biomarkers From Tumor Tissue: Sensitivity Analysis - 0 Versus (1, 2, 3)
outcome.description: Tumor tissue (fresh or archived) was sent to a central laboratory for biomarker HER1/ErbB1 and tumor genetics analysis up to 1 week after randomization. Per RECIST: CR, disappearance of all lesions; PR, a >=30% decrease in the sum of the longest dimensions (LD) of the target lesions (TLs) taking as a reference the baseline sum LD; Progressive disease (PD), a >=20% increase in the sum of the LD of TLs, or the appearance of >=1 new lesion; Stable Disease (SD), neither PR nor PD, persistence of >=1 non-TL. 0=negative; 1, 2, 3=positive (increasing level of biomarker expression).
outcome.time_frame: From the date of randomization until 6 months post chemoradiation treatment, assessed for up to 24 weeks
outcome.population: ITT Population. Participants assessed for HER1/ ErbB1 expression were analyzed.

group.title: Chemoradiotherapy + Placebo, Followed by Placebo
group.description: Participants received radiotherapy once daily (OD), with a dose/fraction <2.5 Gray (Gy) to a total dose of 70 Gy (using two-dimensional [2D] or 3D techniques) or 65 Gy (using Intensity Modulated Radiation Therapy [IMRT]) to the gross site of disease. Concurrent chemotherapy of cisplatin 100 milligrams per meters squared (mg/m^2) was administered intravenously (IV) on Days 1, 22, and 43 of the course of radiotherapy (Study Days 8, 29, and 50). Matching placebo administration commenced 1 week (or less than or equal to 3 days) prior to the concurrent administration with chemoradiation for a duration of up to 6 to 7 weeks. After the completion of chemoradiotherapy, placebo monotherapy was administered until disease progression or withdrawal.

group.title: Chemoradiotherapy + Lapatinib, Followed by Lapatinib
group.description: Participants received radiotherapy once daily (OD), with a dose/fraction <2.5 Gy to a total dose of 70 Gy (using 2D or 3D techniques) or 65 Gy (using IMRT) to the gross site of disease. Concurrent chemotherapy of cisplatin 100 mg/m^2 was administered IV on Days 1, 22, and 43 of the course of radiotherapy (Study Days 8, 29, and 50). Lapatinib 1500 mg OD administration commenced 1 week (or less than or equal to 3 days) prior to the concurrent administration with chemoradiation for a duration of up to 6 to 7 weeks. After the completion of chemoradiotherapy, lapatinib 1500 mg OD monotherapy was administered until disease progression or withdrawal.

measure.description: Tumor tissue (fresh or archived) was sent to a central laboratory for biomarker HER1/ErbB1 and tumor genetics analysis up to 1 week after randomization. Per RECIST: CR, disappearance of all lesions; PR, a >=30% decrease in the sum of the longest dimensions (LD) of the target lesions (TLs) taking as a reference the baseline sum LD; Progressive disease (PD), a >=20% increase in the sum of the LD of TLs, or the appearance of >=1 new lesion; Stable Disease (SD), neither PR nor PD, persistence of >=1 non-TL. 0=negative; 1, 2, 3=positive (increasing level of biomarker expression).
measure.population: ITT Population. Participants assessed for HER1/ ErbB1 expression were analyzed.

class.title: Negative, PD or Death (prior to Week 24)
Positive, PD or Death (prior to Week 24)

outcome.title: Number of Participants Classified as Responders, as Per Volumetric Tumor Response
outcome.time_frame: From the date of randomization until 6 months post chemoradiation treatment, assessed for a median of 13 months
outcome.population: ITT Population. A formal analysis of this outcome measure was never performed; thus data are not available and cannot be reported.

group.title: Chemoradiotherapy + Placebo, Followed by Placebo
group.description: Participants received radiotherapy once daily (OD), with a dose/fraction <2.5 Gray (Gy) to a total dose of 70 Gy (using two-dimensional [2D] or 3D techniques) or 65 Gy (using Intensity Modulated Radiation Therapy [IMRT]) to the gross site of disease. Concurrent chemotherapy of cisplatin 100 milligrams per meters squared (mg/m^2) was administered intravenously (IV) on Days 1, 22, and 43 of the course of radiotherapy (Study Days 8, 29, and 50). Matching placebo administration commenced 1 week (or less than or equal to 3 days) prior to the concurrent administration with chemoradiation for a duration of up to 6 to 7 weeks. After the completion of chemoradiotherapy, placebo monotherapy was administered until disease progression or withdrawal.

group.title: Chemoradiotherapy + Lapatinib, Followed by Lapatinib
group.description: Participants received radiotherapy once daily (OD), with a dose/fraction <2.5 Gy to a total dose of 70 Gy (using 2D or 3D techniques) or 65 Gy (using IMRT) to the gross site of disease. Concurrent chemotherapy of cisplatin 100 mg/m^2 was administered IV on Days 1, 22, and 43 of the course of radiotherapy (Study Days 8, 29, and 50). Lapatinib 1500 mg OD administration commenced 1 week (or less than or equal to 3 days) prior to the concurrent administration with chemoradiation for a duration of up to 6 to 7 weeks. After the completion of chemoradiotherapy, lapatinib 1500 mg OD monotherapy was administered until disease progression or withdrawal.

measure.title: Number of Participants Classified as Responders, as Per Volumetric Tumor Response
measure.population: ITT Population. A formal analysis of this outcome measure was never performed; thus data are not available and cannot be reported.

reported_events.time_frame: Data are presented as of the cut-off date of 1-August-2014.
reported_events.desc: Data are presented for the Safety Population (SP)=participants (par.) who were randomized and took >=1 dose of study medication (SM). One par. randomized to placebo received lapatinib in error and was assigned to the lapatinib arm in the SP. One par. randomized to placebo withdrew from the study prior to receiving SM and was not included in the SP.

group.description: Participants received radiotherapy once daily (OD), with a dose/fraction less than 2.5 Gy to a total dose of 70 Gy (using 2D or 3D techniques) or 65 Gy (using IMRT) to the gross site of disease. Concurrent chemotherapy of cisplatin 100 mg/m^2 was administered IV on Days 1, 22, and 43 of the course of radiotherapy (Study Days 8, 29, and 50). After the completion of chemoradiotherapy, lapatinib 1500 mg OD monotherapy was administered until disease progression or withdrawal.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

event.sub_title: Squamous cell carcinoma of the tongue

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: GSK agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. GSK supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.
